newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: OMV sees 1996 earnings, dividend up.
newsitem.headline: OMV sees 1996 earnings, dividend up.

text.p: Austrian oil and chemicals group OMV should improve on 1995's record earnings this year but the increase will not be "dramatic", chief executive Richard Schenz said on Monday.
"We expect a satisfactory increase but not a dramatic increase," Schenz told Reuters. "I would expect the dividend to be in line with the better result."
Last year OMV, Austria's biggest industrial group, posted net earnings of 1.73 billion schillings and a pre-tax profit of 2.1 billion. It paid a 20 schillings dividend.
He traced this year's expected improvement to strong gains in the price of crude oil and a better than forecast performance in polyolefins.
Crude oil prices raced to six-year highs last week. "Our cautious planning had not budgeted for the highest crude prices since the Gulf War," Schenz said.
An expected second half downturn in polyolefins had also failed to materialise, he added.
Schenz cautioned that recent dynamic growth may not be sustainable next year. "We assume that 1997 will be a more difficult year than 1996," he said.
